issue.title: Add an Annoyance Filter to Block Conversation Boxes at the End of News Posts
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Many news websites display conversation or comment boxes at the end of their articles, often powered by third-party services like Disqus or native commenting systems. These elements can be distracting, slow down page loading, and sometimes contain unwanted or low-quality content. While existing annoyance filters block some of these elements, many still appear on various news sites.

### Proposed solution

Introduce an additional annoyance filter specifically designed to target and block conversation/comment boxes at the end of news articles. This filter should work across multiple popular news websites and support customization in case users want to whitelist specific sites.

### Additional information

Some common platforms that power these comment sections include Disqus, Facebook Comments, Vuukle, and OpenWeb.
- Users who prefer engagement can have an option to disable this filter.
- This would enhance the readability and browsing experience for users who want a cleaner interface.
